image.altText: A fisher along the South Australian coast.

props.synopsis: Support for South Australia's recreational fishing sector amid the ongoing algal bloom crisis will include the creation of an artificial reef in Gulf St Vincent and the expansion of fishing in reservoirs "where consistent with public health advice", the state government says.

title.children: Artificial reef and reservoir fishing to tackle algal bloom's impact on tourism

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera seated in a garden

props.synopsis: For most people, a package delivered to their homes is usually welcomed but for people experiencing domestic violence, alcohol delivery is "like the guided missile that is the match".

title.children: Former Neighbours star urges changes to alcohol delivery laws

image.altText: The Adelaide CBD viewed from the air looking down on West Terrace

props.synopsis: The Lord Mayor wants to nearly double the population of the CBD and North Adelaide by 2036. The last time the city had close to 50,000 residents, it was lectured for having "slums".Â

title.children: Adelaide's plan to double its CBD population without 'destroying the city'

image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch found guilty [File photo].

props.synopsis: Before Bradley Murdoch was arrested for English backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance and the attempted kidnapping of Joanne Lees, the killer faced charges, of which he was acquitted, of raping a woman and her 12-year-old daughter in South Australia. WARNING: This story contains content that some readers may find upsetting.

title.children: Before the Falconio trial, Bradley John Murdoch was accused and acquitted of rape and abduction

image.altText: An Aussie rules player in purple holds his arms out in celebration

props.synopsis: Fremantle recovers from a slow start at Perth Stadium while Geelong complete an absolute drubbing of Port Adelaide. Follow live.

title.children: Dominant Dockers roar back as Carlton fades late on in Perth

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Match report: Jezza century on cards after Cats whack Port

image.altText: A cricketer wearing official whites.

props.synopsis: It's been 15 years since Jake Weatherald moved south to pursue his dream of becoming a professional cricketer, but it was the return to Darwin that served as one of his life's defining moments.

title.children: Darwin-born professional cricketer shines in home-game debut

image.altText: A man with walking sticks on a snowy mountain.

props.synopsis: Matthew Hutchinson says a school scholarship "fundamentally changed his life". He is now trekking across the US to give underprivileged kids the same opportunity.Â

title.children: 'Scruffy' kid who became surgeon thanks to scholarship treks to fund more

image.altText: Two police officers lift police tape on the side of a hill, while they lead a dog on a leash underneath it.

props.synopsis: Several items related to the alleged murder of a Port Lincoln man have been located, a day after a civilian walking their dog found what is believed to be part of his remains. Â Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Further evidence related to alleged Port Lincoln murder found

image.altText: A man makes a snow angle by lying on the ground and waving his arms and legs in a blanket of hail.

props.synopsis: A massive hailstorm transforms parts of far north South Australia into a scene from a European winter, which locals say "really did feel like snow".

title.children: Outback opal miners make 'snow angels' as hail blankets the desert

image.altText: Close up of Richard Boyle's face looking serious outdoors

props.synopsis: Australian Tax Office whistleblower Richard Boyle has argued he should be spared convictions because he was motivated by public interest, and his actions led to change within the federal agency.

title.children: Prosecutor says ATO whistleblower acted unlawfully

image.altText: A man in a dark hoodie, glasses and face mask walks next to two men in business suits outside the court building

props.synopsis: A court has heard Sumit Satish Rastogi, an unqualified massage therapist who sexually abused more than 60 women, is a "monster" and a "disgusting human being" whose offending left a huge impact on his victims.

title.children: Massage therapist who abused more than 60 women hears impact on victims

image.altText: A close up of a phone against a woman's ear.

props.synopsis: About 20 per cent of calls to South Australia's domestic violence crisis line are going unanswered, despite a recent boost in government funding to address demand, the state's peak body for domestic violence services says.

title.children: One in five calls to SA DV crisis line goes unanswered despite extra funding

image.altText: A dump truck emptying a pile of red dirt into a very large mine - there are hills in the background.

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission says we should hike taxes on oligopolies and cut taxes on small businesses if we want the economy to flourish.

title.children: Hit oligopolies, cut tax on businesses and watch Australia's economy grow

image.altText: A close up of Sally McManus in the Insiders studio.

props.synopsis: ACTU Secretary Sally McManus says it's time to "bite the bullet" and reform negative gearing and the capital gains tax to make it easier for young people to enter the housing market.Â

title.children: Union boss calls for one property limit on negative gearing tax breaks

image.altText: A doctor wraps a tape measure around a child's skeletal arm. The circumference is in the "red" category for acute malnutrition.

props.synopsis: Doctors and aid workers say the world's concern over the aid blockade in Gaza has come too late. Many of the children you've read about probably can't be saved.Â

title.children: The red part of this tape represents a point from which children can't return

image.altText: Compilation of photos of men posing for camera with prominent photo of Richard Fidler in suit

props.synopsis: As a child, Richard Fidler was endlessly curious. That same thirst for understanding has guided him behind the Conversations mic, gently drawing captivating stories from his guests.

title.children: What Richard Fidler has learnt from two decades of Conversations

image.altText: Here's Leonardo Puglisi setting up to anchor the 6 News Sunday night bulletin.

props.synopsis: Australian teenagers have grown up on YouTube and admit it can be harmful, but some say the government's blanket ban will do little to address the problems.Â

title.children: Australian teens reflect on losing YouTube, a gen Z cultural fixture

image.altText: A woman in a black long-sleeved surf rashie with a blue boogie board under her arm at the beach.

props.synopsis: From Granny Grommets shredding waves on the Gold Coast to Fitzroy Fossils rowing their way into retirement, these ageing Aussies prove it's never too late to start fitness and fun.

title.children: Secret to ageing well for these Aussies is 'wearing out' not 'rusting out'

image.altText: A list of "Interactive Sex" games and incest titles, in red and strikethrough to indicate they've been removed.

props.synopsis: Thousands of adult video games were pulled from digital storefronts this month after Australian campaign group Collective Shout pressured payment companies including PayPal, Visa and Mastercard.

title.children: An online campaign sparked mass NSFW game takedowns. Then the backlash began

image.altText: A portait of Denise Bowden.

props.synopsis: Pressure is building on the federal government to remove funding from the Northern Territory government unless it meets outcomes on Indigenous incarceration.

title.children: 'No blank cheques': Pressure on federal government to pull territory funding

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin clenches his fist in celebration during a match

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin has staged another great escape to make the quarterfinals of the Canadian Open, where he is looking to defend last year's title.

title.children: Popyrin sets up Zverev showdown in bid to defend Canadian Open crown

image.altText: Image shows an elderly Japanese woman standing in front of a stove in a kitchen

props.synopsis: In Japan, you can rent a grandmother to help cook for you and give you support. What do services like this mean for Japanâs aging population, especially for women?Â

title.children: Elderly women in Japan are keeping themselves employed as grandmas-for-hire

image.altText: A newborn baby is shown lying down, with one of its feet in the foreground of the image.

props.synopsis: The Queensland coroner describes the case of a baby â known to child safety authorities â who starved to death while his mother and her partner were on a drug binge as "utterly tragic".

title.children: Eight-month-old baby dies while mother and partner on drug binge

image.altText: Close-up of part of a grey and white air purifier.

props.synopsis: Even air purifiers with the best filters vary in how well they clear your home of smoke. Here's what to look for in a unit, and how to make the most of it.

title.children: Wood smoke can harm your health. Can an air purifier protect you?

image.altText: A plate of slow-cooker bolognese served with rigatoni and sprinkled with Parmesan cheese and finely chopped parsley.

props.synopsis: Save time and effort in the kitchen with these slow-cooker meals, including a set-and-forget bolognese and plenty of vegetarian options.

title.children: Dinner made easy with our best slow-cooker recipes

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: Back again, I see. Haven't you been humiliated enough?

title.children: You better believe I'm here to judge you. Let's playâ¦ HARD!

image.altText: A close up of a man's face as he stands in front of a bush

props.synopsis: Together, a new body horror starring Alison Brie and Dave Franco, ignited a bidding war at this year's Sundance Film Festival. Now the world is finally being let in to Australian director Michael Shanks's sticky nightmare.

title.children: Australian director went to US to get noticed, sells film for $26m

image.altText: Small beetle crawling and tunneling into wood.

props.synopsis: Researchers say a chemical trial and a biological trial using worms have shown early success in the fight against the shot-hole borer, which has led to the destruction of thousands of Perth's trees.

title.children: Worms eat tree-killing beetle in research trial as scientists team up

image.altText: Young woman with hair down wearing patterned blazer, sitting in well-lit room.

props.synopsis: Lies are circulating on social media, AI chatbots are being manipulated. Hannah Ferguson and Nobel Peace Prize winner Maria Ressa reflect on the dangers of disinformation, and why it can lead to real-world violence.Â

title.children: How social media is amplifying hate and fracturing social cohesion

image.altText: GettyImages-2227452828

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister claims silver behind Katie Ledecky in what is being described as the "race of the century".

title.children: Pallister claims silver in 'race of the century' at world champs

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: The Trump administration quietly reversed a policy that tightened restrictions on microchip exports to China, but why the sudden backflip?Â

title.children: Has Trump just given China a leg-up in the AI arms race?

image.altText: Tadhg Beirne and Tom Curry of the British and Irish Lions clash with Nic White

props.synopsis: Nic White makes his presence felt for the last time as a Wallaby, while Max Jorgensen stuns the Lions for the second time this series. Here are the five quick hits from the third Test at Stadium Australia.

title.children: Five quick hits: Lightning causes havoc, Nic is white hot, and Max stuns again
